kineticstoolkit.kinematics.create_rigid_body_config(markers, marker_names)Â¶

Create a rigid body configuration based on a static acquisition.

Parameters
markers

Markers trajectories during the static acquisition.

marker_names

The markers that define the rigid body.

Returns
Dict[str, Any]

Dictionary with the following keys:

  • MarkerNames : the same as marker_names

  • LocalPoints : a 1x4xM array that indicates the local position of each M marker in the created rigid body config.

Return type

Dict[str, Any]

kineticstoolkit.kinematics.create_virtual_marker_config(markers, rigid_bodies, marker_name, rigid_body_name)Â¶

Create a virtual marker configuration based on a probing acquisition.

Parameters
markers

Markers trajectories during the probing acquisition. This TimeSeries must have at least marker_name in its data keys.

rigid_bodies

Rigid body trajectories during this probing acquisition. This TimeSeries must have at least rigid_body_name in its data keys.

marker_name

Name of the marker to express in local coordinates.

rigid_body_name

Name of the rigid body to express marker_name in relation to.

Returns
Dict[str, Any]

Dictionary with the following keys:

  • RigidBodyName : Name of the virtual markerâs rigid body

  • LocalPoint : Local position of this marker in the reference frame defined by the rigid body RigidBodyName. LocalPoint is expressed as a 1x4 array.

Return type

Dict[str, Any]

kineticstoolkit.kinematics.read_c3d_file(filename)Â¶

Read markers from a C3D file.

The markers positions are returned in a TimeSeries where each marker corresponds to a data key. Each marker position is expressed in this form:

array([[x0, y0, z0, 1.],

[x1, y1, z1, 1.], [x2, y2, z2, 1.], [â¦ ]])

Parameters
filename

Path of the C3D file

Notes

  • This function relies on ezc3d, which is available on conda-forge and on git-hub. Please install ezc3d before using read_c3d_file. https://github.com/pyomeca/ezc3d

  • The point unit must be either mm or m. In both cases, the final unit returned in the output TimeSeries is m.

  • As for any instrument, please check that your data loads correctly on your first use (e.g., sampling frequency, position unit). It is possible that read_c3d_file misses some corner cases.

Return type

TimeSeries

kineticstoolkit.kinematics.read_n3d_file(filename, labels=[])Â¶

Read markers from an NDI N3D file.

The markers positions are returned in a TimeSeries where each marker corresponds to a data key. Each marker position is expressed in this form:

array([[x0, y0, z0, 1.],

[x1, y1, z1, 1.], [x2, y2, z2, 1.], [â¦ ]])

Parameters
filenamestr

Path of the N3D file.

labelslist of str (optional)

Marker names

Returns
TimeSeries
kineticstoolkit.kinematics.register_markers(markers, rigid_body_configs, verbose=False)Â¶

Calculate the trajectory of rigid bodies.

Calculates the trajectory of rigid bodies using ktk.geometry.register_points.

Parameters
markers

Markers trajectories to calculate the rigid body trajectories on.

rigid_body_configs

A dict where each key is a rigid body configuration, and where each rigid body configuration is a dict with the following keys: âMarkerNamesâ and âLocalPointsâ.

verbose

Optional. Set to True to print the rigid body being computed.

Returns
TimeSeries

TimeSeries where each data key is a Nx4x4 series of rigid transformations.

Return type

TimeSeries

kineticstoolkit.kinematics.write_c3d_file(filename, markers)Â¶

Write a markers TimeSeries to a C3D file.

Parameters
filename

Path of the C3D file

markers

Markers trajectories, following the same form as the TimeSeries read by read_c3d_file.

Notes

  • This function relies on ezc3d, which is available on conda-forge and on git-hub. Please install ezc3d before using read_c3d_file. https://github.com/pyomeca/ezc3d

  • The point unit in the output c3d is m.

Return type

None

kineticstoolkit.kinematics.write_trc_file(markers, filename)Â¶

Export a markers TimeSeries to OpenSimâs TRC file format.

Parameters
markersTimeSeries

Markers trajectories.

filenamestr

Name of the trc file to create.

Return type

None
